questionData.question: Oppenheimer is known for the quote 'Death's destroyer.'
The first atomic bomb test took place in 1945.
The code name of the first bomb was 'Trinity.'
Oppenheimer worked at Los Alamos laboratory.
The fuel used in the Hiroshima bomb was Hydrogen-1.
Oppenheimer's role was that of a lead physicist.
The Soviet Union developed its first atomic bomb in 1945.
The main motive behind the Manhattan Project was to explore science.
Oppenheimer's early focus was on quantum physics.
Oppenheimer received a Nobel Prize for his contributions.
Oppenheimer was associated with the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA).
Los Alamos, where Oppenheimer worked, is located in New Mexico.
The bomb dropped on Nagasaki used the same fuel as the one on Hiroshima.
Oppenheimer faced clearance issues due to his communist ties.
Oppenheimer held the position of Professor of Physics at UC Berkeley.
Enrico Fermi was one of Oppenheimer's collaborators in the atomic bomb project.
The anti-nuclear agreement known as NPT stands for 'Non-Proliferation Treaty.'
After WWII, Oppenheimer primarily focused on the development of new weapons.
The biography 'American Prometheus' provides insights into Oppenheimer's life.
During the McCarthy Era, Oppenheimer was cleared of any suspicions.
